pkgmetadata.longdescription: REgularization by Denoising (RED) // Regularization by Denoising uses a denoising engine to solve many image reconstruction ill- posed inverse problems. This is a R implementation of the algorithm developed by Romano et.al. (2016) arXiv:1611.02862. Currently, only the gradient descent optimization framework is implemented. Also, only the median filter is implemented as a denoiser engine. However, (almost) any denoiser engine can be plugged in. There are currently available 3 reconstruction tasks: denoise, deblur and super-resolution. And again, any other task can be easily plugged into the main function 'RED'.
